identificationModule.briefTitle: Identifying Right Ventricular Dysfunction in COPD Through Right Heart Catheterization, Imaging and Exercise
identificationModule.officialTitle: Identifying Patterns of Resting and Exertional Right Ventricular Dysfunction Among Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease and Pulmonary Artery Enlargement

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study plans to learn more about heart function among individuals with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). In particular, the investigators want to understand the different patterns of right ventricular response to pulmonary hypertension (high pressure in the lungs) during rest and exercise. By identifying patterns of right ventricular dysfunction, this study will help identify better treatments for patients with COPD in the future.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Study participants will undergo testing to identify patterns of right ventricular dysfunction. If a study participant decides to participate in exercise training, the participant will complete an exercise training intervention followed by repeat testing to determine impact of exercise training on right ventricular dysfunction.

armGroups.label: COPD with pulmonary artery enlargement
armGroups.description: Participants will complete testing to identify patterns of right ventricular dysfunction. If a participant decides to participate in the optional exercise training program, the participant will complete exercise training followed by repeat testing to determine the impact of exercise training on right ventricular dysfunction.

interventions.name: Exercise training
interventions.description: Exercise training will include supervised high-intensity interval training for \~35 minutes 3x/week on an upright stationary bicycle and unsupervised continuous aerobic exercise for \~30 minutes 2x/week.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Right ventricular-arterial coupling measured by conductance catheter
primaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of end-systolic elastance to effective arterial elastance (Ees/EA)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean pulmonary artery pressure measured by pulmonary artery catheter
Cardiac output measured by pulmonary artery catheter
secondaryOutcomes.description: In L/min, calculated by Fick equation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Right ventricular contractility measured by conductance catheter
secondaryOutcomes.description: Maximum rate of pressure change, dP/dtmax in mmHg/sec

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Right ventricular lusitropy measured by conductance catheter
secondaryOutcomes.description: Minimum rate of pressure change, dP/dtmin in mmHg/sec

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Right ventricular energetics, measured by conductance catheter
Red blood cell acylcarnitine 10:0 measured by peripheral venous metabolomics(ultra-high performance liquid chromatography coupled to mass spectrometry)
Plasma acylcarnitine 10:0 measured by peripheral venous metabolomics (ultra-high performance liquid chromatography coupled to mass spectrometry)
Health-related quality of life by Short Form 36 (SF-36) questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: Units, range 0-100 with greater scores indicating a more favorable health state

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Right to left ventricle diameter ratio measured by computed tomography
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of right ventricle diameter to left ventricle diameter

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Distal pulmonary vascular pruning measured by computed tomography
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of total volume of small pulmonary blood vessels defined by cross-sectional area \<5 mm2 to total volume of all pulmonary blood vessels

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* COPD (determined by ratio of forced expiratory volume in 1 second to forced vital capacity \[FEV1/FVC\] \<0.7) • Pulmonary artery enlargement determined by pulmonary artery-to-aorta ratio \>1 or \>30 mm obtained within 3 years of enrollment and not during an acute exacerbation of COPD

Exclusion Criteria:

* Exacerbation of COPD or use of systemic corticosteroids in the 3 months prior to enrollment
* Change in COPD therapy in the 3 weeks prior to enrollment
* Requirement of \>6 LPM supplemental oxygen at rest
* Requirement of \>10 LPM with exertion
* Active/uncontrolled cardiovascular disease (e.g. hypertension with blood pressure \>150/100 despite antihypertensives; coronary artery disease with angina; left ventricular ejection fraction ≤45%; arrhythmia; pulmonic, mitral or aortic valvular abnormality greater than trace in severity; tricuspid regurgitation greater than mild in severity; diabetes with HbA1c \>7.5%)
* Volume overload (jugular vascular distension or greater than trace peripheral edema)
* Interstitial lung disease
* Untreated obstructive sleep apnea
* Active malignancy
* Medical conditions that limit exercise on an upright stationary bicycle (e.g. osteoarthritis, etc.)
* Pregnancy
* Body mass index \<18.5 or \>35
* Hematocrit \<32% or \>55%
* For optional Part 2 i.e. exercise training and Visit 2, residence \>90 miles from University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus or unwillingness/inability to attend exercise training sessions for approximately 35 minutes 3x/week for 12 weeks
* For optional Part 2 i.e. exercise training and Visit 2, already engaged in routine exercise training (\>30 minutes at \>3 METs 3 times/week or more)

locations.facility: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
